title: Rheumatoid Arthritis Support
description:
myRAteam is the only free, password-protected social network dedicated to those who are living with rheumatoid arthritis. Stay connected & share with others like you who understand. 

Features: 

✓ Keep up with all the photos & updates
✓ Quick photo buttons so you don't miss a beat 
✓ Post updates about the daily ups & downs 
✓ Get/Give instant hugs, likes & comments of support 
✓ Search the Q+A section/ask and answer questions 
✓ Add others to your team 
✓ Find others near you and like you
✓ Add your diagnosis and view others


myRAteam is for those living with rheumatoid arthritis. 

We welcome your feedback! 

Please email us at support@myrateam.com with your comments & suggestions.

Best app ever. Its easy to work. With this app your are never alone there is always some one that cares!
I love this app. I was only using da computer to log in. Didn't know they had an app. It's very convenient...
i downloaded the app & it won't even let me register my info i keep getting error message! not worth my time!
It won't let me set up an account. Won't accept my email address. Says it's not a valid email. ????

title: RA Monitor
description:
The first Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA) monitoring app that connects you to your specialist presents a clean interface and informative reporting. More than just an intuitive tool for tracking your symptoms, their impact on your ability to function, and triggers, RA Monitor allows you to access the support of your specialist (or our RA Navigator) and the anonymous community of other RA sufferers that you can interact with if you choose. Easy-to-read reports can be shared with others, such as family, friends or your healthcare providers. Get daily information that helps get your RA under control, such as news, tips, and inspirations. Designed in concert with RPM Healthcare’s founders' 35+ years of patient education expertise.

Features:
-Free app for arthritis!
-Highly intuitive RA Symptoms Tracker (Location, function impairment, weather, menstrual cycle, stress)
-Medication Tracker (including effectiveness)
-Trigger Tracker
-Easy to register and get started quickly
-Connect to your specialist (or our RA Navigator)—allows healthcare providers to follow your progress between visits. Change providers when you choose.
-Anonymous social networking with other people with RA
-Edit entries for any day using a calendar portal
-Ability to share your symptoms, medication, and trigger reports
-Automatic weather data for analysis
-Detailed reports and insights screen

summary: Track your Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA) symptoms, treatments and triggers
recentChanges: Improvements
comments: I have just installed this app but have been doing my own tracking until now. I am not sure if I can add retrospectively but before I even try I can't see how to change date to British convention and daily temperature to centigrade. Is this possible as I can't see it in settings. These are musts for me. Thanks.

Detailed record for all aspects of your condition, feelings, abilities etc. Takes time and would be better if you could do multiple joints especially in hands. When my hands are bad its hard work selecting each individual joints to log they hurt while making then hurt typing.
It's ok. I'd like to be able to record the times I take meds.

It would be helpful if multiple joints could be selected at the same time when logging symptoms, sometimes when dexterity is more limited, selecting the individual joints and manually documenting is difficult. A food diary would be great too, too track things like gluten, dairy and nightshades

There's a pop up or a bug that is making editing previous days rather difficult. I like this app otherwise. I'd also like to copy and paste symptoms from previous days or copy symptoms from one side and paste it to the other side. I typically have the same issues in both sides and it would be nice to save me extra taps.

title: Paddison Program For Rheumatoid Arthritis
description:
Reverse Rheumatoid Arthritis symptoms naturally with the Paddison Program, the world’s most trusted and reliable approach to minimizing inflammatory arthritis conditions. Ultra-convenient access to training, resources, podcasts, videos and step-by-step guides to help improve Rheumatoid Arthritis and other autoimmune conditions via unique plant-based health and exercise plans.

PODCAST
Get all the episodes of the highly popular Paddison Podcast right in your app. With just one tap you will be listening - or watching – right here on your phone.

DAILY VIDEOS
Follow the Program day by day right with videos that assist, guide and encourage you. A few minutes each day and you’re on track and motivated.

TROUBLESHOOTING CHECKLISTS
Quickly identify issues and get instructions on how to get rid of pain fast and effectively. 

WORK TOGETHER
Use the support forum to speak to Clint Paddison and many others with pain-reversal experience to find quick solutions to all issues related to autoimmune diseases.

EAT GREAT FOOD
Find all the recipes right here. You might like to make them with the phone right next to you on the kitchen counter.

GET MOVING THE RIGHT WAY
Exercise well without aggravating your condition. Instructional videos will get you moving for pain relief and improved health. Videos include Yoga with Melissa and unique joint-specific plans for inflammatory arthritis.

MINDFULLNESS
Calming meditations and yoga nidras will help you to lower stress levels regardless of your age or location. Combine this with our pro-action affirmations and you’ll have the mindset and mental clarity to heal.

NEW BLOG POSTS
Keen learning new things and gain a deeper understanding of old concepts. From RA medications and their side-effects, right through to the benefits of leafy greens, you’ll get a full spectrum of training right to your handheld device.

SOCIAL MEDIA NOTIFICATIONS
Connect socially with others on the Program or from Clint and Melissa Paddison, who post regular helpful tips and news about improving your health and wellbeing. 

Learn more about the Paddison Program at www.paddisonprogram.com

At best, through Clint's program, you will be able to arrest this disease and live a fairly normal life. At worst you will become vastly informed and empowered to live an overall healthier life. This is courageous, avante garde genious.
All the PP information in one easy place
Amazing app. Total game changer.
User friendly, great relatable content!

title: Rheumatoid Arthritis Treatment Guidelines
description:
Rheumatoid Arthritis Treatment Learning, One cause of arthritis is an autoimmune disease that forces the body to enter a self-preservation routine that subsequently attacks healthy tissues. The body, due to this disease, believes the healthy tissues are a threat to it. There is no known cause of the autoimmune disease but some information on rheumatoid arthritis cites environmental factors as a possible cause. Viruses including bacteria and fungus are also factors in its development. Information of Rheumatoid Arthritis: Treatments, focuses on the treatments of the disease rather than the cause.

Learn More About:

- rheumatoid arthritis symptoms	
- rheumatoid arthritis causes	
- rheumatoid arthritis diagnosis

Rheumatoid arthritis is different to osteoarthritis, which tends to affect older people as a degenerative disease. Information on rheumatoid arthritis suggests that it can attack not only cartilage in the joints, but also bones as well. When pain related to arthritis is experiences, it can be difficult to identify the exact root of the problem, but thorough diagnosis by a doctor will determine if the pain is the result of a natural progression of lost cartilage or an internal strike from the body's immune system.

Constant repetition of the inflammation of bone tissue can cause the pain in the joint to come and go, making a full diagnosis difficult. Additional exploratory x-rays and CAT-scans are often needed to help find out the cause of the pain. Of the information on rheumatoid arthritis that we have available, it implies that the degeneration can cause is symmetrical, for example, if one hand is affected, the other hand will be too.

If you want learn about Rheumatoid Arthritis Treatment, download this app.

title: My Arthritis
description:
My Arthritis Care is a clinician-approved, patient-designed app for patients with the following conditions:

	•	Rheumatoid Arthritis
	•	Psoriatic Arthritis
	•	Enteropathic Arthritis
	•	Ankylosing Spondylitis
	•	Osteoarthritis
	•	Osteoporosis
	•	Undifferentiated Arthritis
	•	Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
	•	Sjogren’s syndrome
	•	Vasculitis
	•	Scleroderma
	•	Behcet’s syndrome
	•	Sarcoidosis. 

The app - and its clinician-focused counterpart, HealthSuite - helps patients take control of their condition and improve their health outcomes.

Anyone can use the app to 
	•	track flares and maintain a symptom log to identify what may be causing them
	•	manage your care plan, medication and hospital/GP appointments
	•	access and share your medical records from anywhere
	•	obtain advice and discover local events organised by leading patient groups
	•	access useful information from National Rheumatoid Arthritis Society

Patients whose clinical teams have signed up can also
	•	communicate with their care teams via messaging and phone
	•	report symptoms remotely, allowing care teams to intervene early as required

The app was co-developed with leading academics and clinicians at Kings College Hospital, with inputs from patients and patient groups.

We’re committed to continuously improving our service to make it more useful to patients and clinicians, so please look out for regular updates.

recentChanges: Bug fixes and minor improvements
comments: I have been using it for one week, entering notes and have medication reminder set up. It was simple to use BUT now the app crashes on launch... So I lost all my notes..

I was frequently diagnosed with RA, a lot of medications, appointments, blood tests and exercises were thrown at me. I have had such a hard time keeping track of my medications and appointments and this app helps me keep everything organized in one place. It reminds me to take my medications on time, when my next appointment Is and keep track of my condition. The app includes articles that give useful tips, based on your condition. If you have any form of arthritis this app helps a lot.
I downloaded this a couple of weeks ago. It's easy to use and helps me keep track of my symptoms and medication, especially as I have just started on new injections.
You fill in your details and get pin . On entering email and pin goes back to sign up or sign in screen. Every time I try to log in.

title: Rheumatoid Arthritis Diet
description:
Foods that are rich to contaminate the ill-effects of Rheumatoid Arthritis include:

1. Fiber-rich fruits and vegetables
The diet should focus on fiber-rich fruits and vegetables since it helps to bring down the CRP (C-reactive protein) blood level. CRP plays an active role in increasing inflammation problems. It is a major source to cure the symptoms and promote a healthier life. The antioxidants present in the fruits and vegetables take active part in stabilizing free radical molecules that are responsible for damaging human cells.

2. Extra-virgin olive oil
Extra-virgin olive oil is the best way to replace the consumption of drugs like aspirin and ibuprofen. Within these oils, there is an oleocanthal component present which takes an active participating in blocking the enzymes resulting in inflammation. The consumption of olive oil must be taken keeping in view that it doesn’t result in weight gain.

3. Peas, beans, and nuts
Peas and beans are a great source of protein which is a must to be present in every diet plan. People suffering from rheumatoid arthritis are likely to lose muscle strength. With the protein-rich diet, muscle health is also supported. For protecting any heart problems, nuts are the best option. It could include hazelnuts, almonds, pistachios, and pine nuts.

4. Fish oil
If you’re looking to get relief from tender joints, then fish oil is the best solution. The early morning stiffness can be eliminated with the consumption of fish oil in the Rheumatoid Arthritis Diet. It helps to get rid of a certain amount of medications. With its consumption, a human body gets the essential omega-3 fatty acids to cure the health condition. The consumption of fish oil should remain within a suitable dosage as high doses may come in an interaction with the drugs consumed during medication and result in high blood pressure.

5. Cold-water fish
The cold-water fishes are a great product for a balanced Rheumatoid Arthritis Diet. It could include tuna, trout, halibut, anchovies, salmon, mackerel, and herring. Breakfast can be done with white fish or lox. Prepare salads from shrimp or crab and a flounder sandwich could be a great option for the meal. The omega-3 fatty acids present in fish is not easily found in any other product. These anti-inflammatory foods are rich for curing the arthritis symptoms.

What are the foods to avoid for Rheumatoid Arthritis?

There exist certain foods that may worsen the health condition and leads to joint or muscle pains. The foods to be removed from your diet include:


1. Meat
Meat is a disaster for a health condition as it contains high saturated fats, which opens the way to inflammation in the body. It also results in obesity problems.

2. Sugar
It is a must that one must maintain a proper blood sugar level in the arthritis problems. The sugar foods or sweet drinks can raise the blood sugar levels in the body which produces cytokines. Cytokines are the chemicals that result in inflammation problems and joint pains.

3. Gluten
Gluten is mostly found in barley or wheat and is a must to be avoided. It results in severe joint pressures and also causes an autoimmune disorder. This disorder is a major factor resulting in celiac diseases.  

4. Alcohol
The effect of alcohol is not easily treatable by the medications also. Its consumption, lower down the progression of arthritis condition. The C-reactive protein present in it is a powerful source of inflammatory problems.


With this article, one gets a clear view of the foods to consume and avoid in the diet. It is a must that a well-balanced diet must be followed to see good results.
In this application you will find:

•	Foods That Can Help RA Symptoms
•	Nutrition Guidelines for People With Rheumatoid Arthritis
•	Tips for Living with Rheumatoid Arthritis
•	Nutrition & Rheumatoid Arthritis
•	Much, much more about Rheumatoid Arthritis Diet.

Download this app now and get Rheumatoid Arthritis Diet.

title: RheumaHelper
description:
** The award-winning mobile tool for rheumatologists **

** Won "Good Practice 2016" the highest award by the leading Slovenian medical publication **
** Named a Top Rheumatoid Arthritis App of 2015, 2016, 2017, and 2018 by Healthline **

RheumaHelper is a mobile rheumatology assistant. It provides a complete toolbox of disease activity calculators and classification criteria the informed rheumatologist can reference during day-to-day work. Easy to use and always with you on your mobile phone, RheumaHelper is the perfect tool for rheumatologists.

** Verified content based on published research **

The validity of the content in the application is checked by Prof. Matija Tomšič, M.D., Ph.D., head of the Dept. of Rheumatology, and Žiga Rotar, M.D., rheumatologist at the Dept. of Rheumatology, both at the University Clinical Centre in Ljubljana, Slovenia.

Included classifications:
— Adult Still's disease [Cush]
— Adult Still's disease [Yamaguchi]
— Antiphospholipid syndrome
— Arthralgia suspicious for progression to RA [2016 EULAR]
— Axial spondyloarthritis
— Behçet’s Disease (ICBD)
— Fibromyalgia [2016 ACR]
— Gout [2015 ACR/EULAR]
— Gout [2014]
— Idiopathic inflammatory myopathies specification [2017 ACR/EULAR]
— Inflammatory Back Pain
— Peripheral spondyloarthritis
— Polymyalgia rheumatica
— Primary Sjögren's Syndrome [2016 ACR/EULAR]
— Psoriatic arthritis
— Rheumatoid arthritis
— Systemic lupus erythematosus [ACR]
— Systemic lupus erythematosus [SLICC]
— Systemic sclerosis

Included disease activity calculators:
— ASDAS
— BASDAI
— BVAS [version 3]

descriptionHTML:
** The award-winning mobile tool for rheumatologists **

** Won "Good Practice 2016" the highest award by the leading Slovenian medical publication **
** Named a Top Rheumatoid Arthritis App of 2015, 2016, 2017, and 2018 by Healthline **

RheumaHelper is a mobile rheumatology assistant. It provides a complete toolbox of disease activity calculators and classification criteria the informed rheumatologist can reference during day-to-day work. Easy to use and always with you on your mobile phone, RheumaHelper is the perfect tool for rheumatologists.

** Verified content based on published research **

The validity of the content in the application is checked by Prof. Matija Tomšič, M.D., Ph.D., head of the Dept. of Rheumatology, and Žiga Rotar, M.D., rheumatologist at the Dept. of Rheumatology, both at the University Clinical Centre in Ljubljana, Slovenia.

Included classifications:
— Adult Still's disease [Cush]
— Adult Still's disease [Yamaguchi]
— Antiphospholipid syndrome
— Arthralgia suspicious for progression to RA [2016 EULAR]
— Axial spondyloarthritis
— Behçet’s Disease (ICBD)
— Fibromyalgia [2016 ACR]
— Gout [2015 ACR/EULAR]
— Gout [2014]
— Idiopathic inflammatory myopathies specification [2017 ACR/EULAR]
— Inflammatory Back Pain
— Peripheral spondyloarthritis
— Polymyalgia rheumatica
— Primary Sjögren's Syndrome [2016 ACR/EULAR]
— Psoriatic arthritis
— Rheumatoid arthritis
— Systemic lupus erythematosus [ACR]
— Systemic lupus erythematosus [SLICC]
— Systemic sclerosis

Included disease activity calculators:
— ASDAS
— BASDAI
— BVAS [version 3]
— CDAI / SDAI
— DAPSA
— DAS28
— EULAR Sjögren’s Syndrome Disease Activity Index (ESSDAI)
— EULAR Sjögren’s Syndrome Patient Reported Index (ESSPRI)
— Five-Factor Score
— PASI
— SELENA-SLEDAI
— Vasculitis Damage Index

All of the included classifications and disease activity calculators are based on referenced equations. All references available inside the app.

title: RA Healthline
description:
You’re not alone, even if living with rheumatoid arthritis sometimes makes it seem that way. There’s a whole world of people living with rheumatoid arthritis just like you, waiting to connect and lend support.

Whether you’re newly diagnosed or a seasoned vet, you can meet others who understand exactly what you’re going through because they’ve been there too.

Our mission is to empower people to live beyond their condition through compassion, support, and knowledge. From one-to-one chats to group discussions, we make connecting easy. This is a safe place to find and receive advice, to seek and offer support, and to discover the latest news and research updates curated, just for you.

HOW IT WORKS

Feed Your Soul 
Like all of your favorite social networks, we’ve designed an activity feed to connect you with other members, like you, living with rheumatoid arthritis. We pride ourselves on making RA Healthline a safe and secure space where you can join live discussions, connect one-to-one, and read the latest news and wellness articles about your condition.

Live Discussions with RA Community Leaders
Gain advice and share whatever is on your mind in any one of our groups. It’s a great way to swap stories, ask questions, and share ideas while meeting others in the community. Five nights a week, join our RA Healthline guide and experts in the community as they lead live discussions in one of these groups:
General
Pain Management
Medication and Treatments
Flares and Remission
Alternative Therapies
Escape From RA
Lifestyle
Mental and Emotional Health
Navigating Healthcare
Daily Life
Relationships
Work
Diagnosis
Symptoms
Complications


Meet Your Match
Let us connect you with a new member from our community every day. We’ll recommend members to you based on your treatment plan, lifestyle interests, and needs. Browse member profiles and request to connect with anyone from our community, even instantly, with members listed as “Online now.”

Connect Anytime, Anywhere
Access support with ease from your Members screen. Check and send messages, see who’s online, and get notified when a new message comes in, all so you’ll never miss a thing.

Discover the World of Rheumatoid Arthritis
Get handpicked wellness and news stories reviewed by Healthline’s team of medical professionals delivered to you each week. Stay informed about new treatments, what’s trending, and the latest in clinical trials. Find ways to nurture your body, mind, and spirit for a new kind of support.


ABOUT HEALTHLINE

Healthline Media is the top ranked health publisher and number 44 on Comscore’s Top 100 Property rankings. Across all of its properties, Healthline Media publishes each month up to 1,000 scientifically accurate yet reader-friendly articles authored by more than 120 writers and reviewed by more than 100 doctors, clinicians, nutritionists, and other experts. The company’s repository contains more than 70,000 articles, each updated with current protocol.

More than 200 million people worldwide and 86 million people in the U.S. visit Healthline’s sites each month, according to Google Analytics and Comscore, respectively.

title: Living With RA
description:
Download the Living With RA app if you have enrolled on your clinic’s Living With Rheumatoid Arthritis platform. 

Living With RA app connects people to their RA consultants in order to track condition activity, flare-ups and support awareness of personal trends and triggers. 

Designed with rheumatology consultants working in the NHS.

Living With RA is by invitation only. 

----

Living With RA aims to help you better understand the state of your RA with condition tracking through flare-up reporting, outcome questionnaires and educational articles from the National Rheumatoid Arthritis Society (NRAS).

It is suitable for anyone who is seeing a specialist rheumatologist for problems connected to rheumatoid arthritis. 

Living With RA is simple to use, informative, sends reminders to complete questionnaires and has helpful visual records of your condition activity to support awareness of personal trends and triggers.

Features include:
-	Flare-up reporting
-	Patient report outcome measures (PROMs) questionnaires such as HAQ-DI and RAPID3
-	Receive reminders for PROMs recommended by your RA consultant
-	Educational articles from the National Rheumatoid Arthritis Society (NRAS)

The Living With RA app and the Living With Rheumatoid Arthritis platform comply with the NHS Information Governance requirements.

-----

To find out if you are able to access the Living With RA app, ask your clinician if they have the Living With Rheumatoid Arthritis platform.

Or let your clinic know you’re interested in signing up here: livingwith.health/requestlivingwithra

title: Atlas of Rheumatoid Arthritis
description:
Atlas of Rheumatoid Arthritis- Animated Videos collection

The Atlas of Rheumatoid Arthritis –Animated Videos collection, is a comprehensive collection of videos and images pertaining to disabling, autoimmune disease that affects the joints. The Animated Atlas is an excellent reference and an invaluable resource for effective presentations and lectures.

Focus Animated Atlas series is a collection of authentic animation videos and images covering the key mechanisms, drug interactions and treatment process of a given disease condition. Created with the expertise of internationally reputed opinion leaders, these incredible animation videos accompanied by audio make it easier to perceive and understand the cellular world, metabolism, and body functions. The animations in this application simplify the understanding of biological processes and their mechanisms of action using visual media that is particularly well suited for the science of medicine. The high quality animations take the viewer on a virtual tour of the human system through accurate visuals to effortlessly understand chronic diseases and their mechanisms of action, and management including drug interactions. 

Atlas of Rheumatoid Arthritis Videos collection: is a collection of 61 animated videos with 138 corresponding images covering:

Symptoms & contributory factors
a. Rheumatoid arthritis
b. Synovial membrane
c. Joints involved in RA
d. Autoimmunity and RA
e. Stages of RA
f. Neurogenic Inflammation
g. Rheumatoid nodules
h. Genes associated with RA
i. Rheumatoid factor
j. Joint and cartilage in RA
k. Juvenile rheumatoid arthritis
l. Synovial fluid in RA
m. Synovial lining
n. Anemia in RA
o. Bone erosion in RA
p. Autoantigens in RA
q. Rheumatoid arthritis pathogenesis pathway
r. Inflammation in RA
s. Angiogenesis

Immunopathology
a. Role of TNF alpha
b. Interleukin-1
c. Rheumatoid arthritis synovial fibroblasts (RASFs)
d. Role of T-cells
e. Role of B-cells
f. Macrophages
g. Leukocyte homing to synovium
h. Platelets in the disease process of RA
i. Fas and RA
j. Role of interleukin-18 (IL-18) in inflammatory diseases
k. Role of chondrocytes in rheumatoid arthritis
l. Role of dendritic cells in RA
m. Role of IL-6
n. Cytokines in RA
o. Chemokines in RA
p. Neutrophil migration and action
q. Interleukin-15
r. Interleukin-17
s. Matrix metalloproteinases (MMPs)
t. Prostaglandin E2
u. Apoptosis in RA

Therapeutic & surgical interventions
a. Monoclonal antibody to CD20 antigen
b. T cell costimulatory blockade
c. Anti-human IL-6 receptor antibody
d. Targeting oncostatin M
e. Targeting the epigenetic modifications of synovial cells
f. Gene therapy
g. Anti-Fas monoclonal antibodies
h. Recombinant human IL-1 receptor antagonist therapy
i. Cytokine blockadeArthroplasty
j. Arthroplasty
k. SynovectomyTendon repair
l. Arthrodesis (fusion)
m. TNF alpha inhibitors
n. Hip replacement
o. Arthroscopic synovectomy
p. Total knee replacement
q. Arthrocentesis

DISCLAIMER: The information provided in this application is only intended to be informative and should not be construed as a substitute for medical advice.

Focus Medica Clients:
Boehringer, Roche, MSD, Norgine, Novartis, Wyeth, Allergan, Schering-Plough, Sanofi-Aventis, GlaxoSmithKline, Pfizer, Bayer, Astra-Zeneca, Sun Pharma, Dr. Reddy's Labs, CIPLA, Merck

title: Arthritis Tracker
description:
Created with young people for young people, Arthritis Tracker lets you rate your symptoms in seconds and see a summary of your recent pain, sore joints (e.g. knee, fingers, hands), medication side effects, energy levels, activity, sleep and emotions. 

You can use these summaries to help you talk to your healthcare professionals at medical appointments or simply to see how you’ve been doing recently.

With Arthritis Tracker, you can also:
-learn how to handle your symptoms, your flare-ups, manage your stress, and reduce the impact that arthritis has on your daily life 
-get tips on talking to other people about your arthritis
-find out how you can manage your condition alongside your school or university coursework and exams
-read stories from other young people with arthritis and get inspired by their experiences and advice 
-get trusted information about juvenile idiopathic arthritis
-find information about Versus Arthritis events coming up in the UK
-learn how to connect with Versus Arthritis and get support online.

Arthritis Tracker is designed for young people aged 13 to 25, and Versus Arthritis is always working to incorporate young people’s ideas about how to make the app better. Learn more about the improvements we’ve made here: www.versusarthritis.org/arthritis-tracker

Healthcare professionals who treat people with juvenile idiopathic arthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, lupus or other inflammatory conditions (e.g. rheumatologists, rheumatology teams) can order leaflets for their clinics and get ideas about how to use Arthritis Tracker during health appointments. Visit Versus Arthritis for more information: www.versusarthritis.org/arthritis-tracker-health-professionals

title: ReumApp
description: ReumApp es una aplicación médica diseñada y editada desde Colombia. Es la App médica con contenidos de reumatología más completos, actualizados, prácticos y didácticos. En ReumApp encontrará contenidos teóricos con la definición, epidemiología, cuadro clínico, diagnóstico y tratamiento de todas las enfermedades reumáticas. Además, cuenta con videos en alta definición, mediante los cuales se explica la forma correcta de realizar el examen físico osteoarticular. Una de los contenidos más importantes de ReumApp son las calculadoras médicas. En nuestra aplicación encontrará calculadoras de los criterios de clasificación más recientes de todas las enfermedades reumáticas, así como calculadoras de clinimetría para artritis reumatoide, espondiloartritis y lupus eritematosos sistémico. ReumApp se actualiza constantemente con la sección de actualidad, en la cual encontrará noticias de interés en reumatología y dermatología. ReumApp tiene un sólido equipo médico que provee la mejor y más actualizada información, para que esta aplicación se convierta en la principal ayuda de la consulta médica en reumatología y de otras áreas de la medicina en las cuales se atienden pacientes reumáticos (medicina interna, medicina familiar, medicina general, medicina física y rehabilitación, ortopedia, dermatología, neurocirugía, neurología, clínicas de dolor, entre otras).  ReumApp brinda una experiencia de navegación agradable e intuitiva, que permite al usuario desplazarse por el menú, en el que listan en forma alfabética las principales enfermedades en reumatología. ReumApp es una aplicación gratuita que busca llevar la más completa información en reumatología a todos los médicos que la necesiten en cualquier parte del mundo. El fin último de ReumApp es mejorar la atención de los pacientes reumáticos, al ser una fuente de consulta para el médico con sus contenidos teóricos y videos didácticos y una herramienta de trabajo con las calculadoras de criterios de clasificación y las calculadoras de clinimetría.

ReumApp tiene un sólido equipo médico que provee la mejor y más actualizada información, para que esta aplicación se convierta en la principal ayuda de la consulta médica en reumatología y de otras áreas de la medicina en las cuales se atienden pacientes reumáticos (medicina interna, medicina familiar, medicina general, medicina física y rehabilitación, ortopedia, dermatología, neurocirugía, neurología, clínicas de dolor, entre otras).  ReumApp brinda una experiencia de navegación agradable e intuitiva, que permite al usuario desplazarse por el menú, en el que listan en forma alfabética las principales enfermedades en reumatología. ReumApp es una aplicación gratuita que busca llevar la más completa información en reumatología a todos los médicos que la necesiten en cualquier parte del mundo. El fin último de ReumApp es mejorar la atención de los pacientes reumáticos, al ser una fuente de consulta para el médico con sus contenidos teóricos y videos didácticos y una herramienta de trabajo con las calculadoras de criterios de clasificación y las calculadoras de clinimetría.
summary: Information, calculators diagnosis of rheumatic diseases.
developerAddress: Cra 25 A # 1B-47 Piso 2

La actualización de julio de 2020 de ReumApp trae los Criterios de clasificación 2017 eular/acr para miopatías inflamatorias idiopáticas en adultos y jóvenes y sus principales subgrupos.

Seguimos trabajando para hacer de ReumApp la aplicación número 1 en reumatología.
comments: Buenísimo!

title: DAS28 - Rheumatoid Arthritis
description:
DAS 28 - Disease Activity Score Calculator for Rheumatoid Arthritis.
DAS28, a modified version of the original DAS, is a quantitative measure of disease activity used to monitor the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis. DAS28, which stands for "disease activity score," is calculated using a formula that includes the number of tender joints and swollen joints (28 joints maximum). DAS28 is not only useful for assessing patients in clinical practice but for clinical trials as well.

You can calculate the DAS28 ESR (default) or DAS28 CRP

title: RheumaKit
description: RheumaKit for patients allows patients with rheumatic conditions to monitor their health status over time and to feed their clinician with the information they want, when and from where they want. Several conditions are covered, like rheumatoid arthritis, spondyloarthropathy, psoriatic arthritis, microcrystalline arthritis (gout), lupus (SLE), osteoarthritis, etc. The benefits for the patients are numerous: reduce the frequency of visits to the rheumatologist (in agreement with the rheumatologist), detect earlier the failure/inefficacy of an ongoing treatment, and thus earlier adpatation of the therapeutic strategy. This adds up naturally to the fact that the user has an objective idea of his/her status with respect to a rheumatic condition and its evolution over time, which in itself is a benefit. The app thus really allows to follow the "treat-to-target" trend. This mobile application can be connected to RheumaKit.com, a web platform for personalized medicine in Rheumatology to be used by the clinicians. Each clinician can store a much larger collection of information of interest regarding each patient. The types of information that can be managed by the clinicians are related to treatment, to diagnosis or to disease activity and can include biological and even genomic testing. Currently, the mobile application allows the follow-up of the user via three self-reported metrics: the simplified Health Assessment Questionaire (HAQ-DI), the Routine Assessment of Patient Index Data 3 (RAPID3), recommended by the American College of Rheumatology (ACR), and the Knee Injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (KOOS). These three indices allow for the monitoring of the disease activity.

title: Guidelines And Criteria
description:
The American College of Rheumatology’s Guideline and Criteria App is the go-to tool for implementing guideline recommendations and criteria sets into practice. Free to both members and non-members, this app is ACR’s mobile home for tools and content for clinicians caring for patients with rheumatic diseases. App features include: interactive tools to inform treatment decisions at the point of care, including algorithms, score and calculators; full guideline and criteria content; keyword searches; customizable bookmarks; and note-taking capabilities.

Current guidelines and criteria in the app include:

· Guideline for the Treatment of Rheumatoid Arthritis

· Guideline for the Prevention and Treatment of Glucocorticoid-Induced Osteoporosis

· Guideline for the Perioperative Management of Antirheumatic Medication in Patients with Rheumatic Diseases Undergoing Total Hip or Knee Arthroplasty

· Guideline for Treatment of Psoriatic Arthritis

· Rheumatoid Arthritis Classification Criteria

· Systemic Sclerosis Classification Criteria

· Gout Classification Criteria

· Sjogren’s Syndrome Classification Criteria

· Myositis Classification Criteria

Stay tuned for ongoing updates, as well as new guideline and criteria tools and content.

Send feedback to the ACR directly from the App Information page or post a review in the App Store. 
Help us find new and better ways to deliver guideline and criteria content to clinicians.

title: Arthritis: Causes, Diagnosis, and Treatment
description:
Arthritis is a term often used to mean any disorder that affects joints. Symptoms generally include joint pain and stiffness. Other symptoms may include redness, warmth, swelling, and decreased range of motion of the affected joints. In some types other organs are also affected.[6] Onset can be gradual or sudden 
There are over 100 types of arthritis. The most common forms are osteoarthritis (degenerative joint disease) and rheumatoid arthritis. Osteoarthritis usually occurs with age and affects the fingers, knees, and hips. Rheumatoid arthritis is an autoimmune disorder that often affects the hands and feet. Other types include gout, lupus, fibromyalgia, and septic arthritis. They are all types of rheumatic disease. 
==========================
APP FEATURES
==========================
This exclusive app will help to understand the Arthritis symptoms, Arthritis management, Arthritis causes, Arthritis diagnosis, Arthritis Prognosis, Arthritis Epidemiology and history. 
Here are features that make this app better than all other Arthritis Disease apps - 
-	UI of app is very user responsive and easy to navigate. 
-	Easily Change the page.
-	Data of app is collected from various research reports.
-	You can access these favorites whenever you want.
-	Share your favorite benefits with your friends and family through email, SMS, Twitter, Facebook, and WhatsApp.

All these features are available for free. 

==========================
SAY HELLO
==========================
Any medical information published on this app is not intended as a substitute for informed medical advice and you should not take any action before consulting with a healthcare professional. Our team are nonstop working hard on creation this app. Please feel free to review and email us for any questions/suggestions/complications. If you have liked any feature and information of this app, please do not forget to rate us on play store. title: Elsa – Impact your rheumatoid arthritis
description:
Elsa helps you understand how your habits and your medical treatment affect your rheumatoid arthritis (RA).

With Elsa you can do research on yourself! By logging your habits you will be able to better understand how your choices affect your illness and your well-being. Your experiences will also be used to help others with rheumatoid arthritis – and wider research. By using the app, you help not only yourself, but others living with the same illness too. 

How are you feeling today? Enter your symptoms and information about your well-being in a few simple steps.

Log treatment and habits. Choose what you want to monitor, such as physical activity or smoking.

Find out what makes you feel good! See how your habits can change and affect your symptoms.

Use the insights and data that you think are relevant as support when you meet doctors or healthcare staff.

Elsa is a CE marked medical technology product that is registered with the Swedish Medical Products Agency.

Elsa is currently being co-developed by designers, developers, researchers, healthcare providers and patients across Sweden.

title: Rheumatology UCT
description:
The Division of Rheumatology at the University of Cape Town is very actively involved in teaching, service delivery and research.

Teaching is directed at medical students in their 4th 5th and 6th years of training. There is also training for post graduates specialising in general medicine in the form of registrar rotations through Rheumatology, as well as formal teaching for the Part 1 and Part 2 of the FCP (SA) examinations. Medical registrars rotating through the unit are encouraged to undertake rheumatology topics for the MPhil degree. The Division is highly suited for training super specialists in Rheumatology due to the wide spectrum of rheumatic diseases that are treated in the different clinics.

Service is provided through several outpatient clinics and inpatients admitted to the general medical wards as well as the orthopaedic wards. Patients with severe RA may be admitted for surgery or for rehabilitation purposes. There are 2 new patient clinics per week and 2 follow-up clinics per week. In addition, a weekly Connective Tissue Diseases clinic has been established for treating patients with SLE, Scleroderma, Myositis and different forms of vasculitis, especially Takayasu’s Disease.

The Division of Rheumatology has several research interests relating to different aspects of the rheumatic diseases. Osteoporosis is an area of interest for many years and there is ongoing collection of longitudinal bone mineral density data in patients with rheumatoid arthritis (RA) and systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE). Age-related bone loss at different skeletal sites is being prospectively studied in collaboration with the Department of Nuclear Medicine and the Endocrine Unit. Clinical drug trials are in progress to study the safety and efficacy of the newer non steroidal anti inflammatory drugs (NSAIDS), in collaboration with the GIT Unit. These newer COXIBS are being evaluated in patients with RA and osteoarthritis (OA). All of these include collaborative participation with the GIT Unit, where gastropathy is an outcome variable, measured by gastroscopy. Recently, the trials of coxibs have included cardiovascular outcomes as well. We have also been looking at SLE genetics in collaboration with the Hepatology Unit at UCT. Newer areas of research include the study of chronic tophaceous GOUT; community aspects of diagnosing and treating rheumatic diseases at CHC’s; early rheumatoid arthritis; genetics of bone loss in SLE; and functional problems in ankylosing spondylitis and DMARDs in Psoriatic Arthritis. More recently, we have been involved in studies looking at the short-term and long-term effects of biologic therapiesin the different rheumatic diseases, especially RA.

The rheumatic diseases unit provides in- and outpatient rheumatology services for the entire Western Cape region. Sessions are carried out at the Heideveld and Khayelitsha Community Health Centres 6 times a year. Training is provided on a continuous basis for medical students, allied health professionals, a senior house officer, two rotating medical registrars and two career registrars. Research is largely clinically orientated, but a laboratory-based approach is being used to study the genetics of SLE and the differentiation between flares and infection in SLE patients. Family studies have also been started in patients with SLE and RA. In addition, there is very significant involvement in clinical drug trials in rheumatoid arthritis, systemic lupus erythematosus, psoriatic arthritis and osteoarthritis. Collaborative research is being carried out with the Liver Unit to study bone density in auto-immune hepatitis.

title: Manage My Pain
description:
Chronic pain affects 1 in 5 individuals. It can be hard to explain to friends, family, and doctors. It can feel like it's taking control of your life and your mental health. Learn to conquer your chronic pain. Manage My Pain helps you and others better understand what you are going through. It has helped thousands of people with conditions like fibromyalgia, headaches, arthritis, or back pain better understand their symptoms and provide evidence of their pain for their doctors, insurance companies, or government agencies. Manage My Pain was created in partnership with industry-leading pain researchers - your doctor will actually read the reports from our app! Our daily reflections help people focus on their meaningful activities as opposed to the limitations created by their pain.

Manage My Pain will help you:
• Record how you're feeling: Easily describe your pain in less than 30 seconds
• Understand your unique pain criteria: Fully customizable options with each pain record let you identify factors such as how your pain feels, what the factors made the pain worse, which medications help you with your pain, and many more
• Reflect on your day: Take your mind off pain and record activities that are meaningful to you
• Highlight patterns and trends: Charts and graphs describe your results and get more powerful over time
• Track how well your meds are working: Add any medication to your profile and mark if it helps manage your pain
• Describe your pain to your doctor: Summarize your pain through unique reports that your doctor will actually read

Developed for patients suffering from and care-givers or medical professionals treating: 
• arthritis & rheumatism
• cancer 
• chronic pain
• headaches & migraines 
• fibromyalgia 

Use this pain management app to replace your hand-written: 
• pain diary 
• pain journal 
• pain log 
• pain tracker 

The Pro version adds the ability to view or report on more than the last 30 days. Reports are free to generate, however, those that contain advanced sections may require an additional credit to be purchased. An optional monthly subscription can be purchased so that an unlimited number of reports with advanced sections may be generated without the need for credits.

comments: **UPDATE** after receiving response from customer support (which was expedient and right on the money for what I needed). I absolutely LOVE this app!!! (upgrade from 4 stars to 5!!) Once I was clear on how to use app, I really appreciate having somewhere to log my daily concerns. I do wish there were more specific body parts, but I LOVE that u can put notes in and be more specific there.

Really great free app with incredibly reasonably priced premium levels (although I've not needed to upgrade from free yet so can't comment on their pros & cons). You can add your own pain descriptors and chart things like mental fog and fatigue. It doesn't take too long to fill out and you can easily change the entry date. The only thing I "don't like" is that it defaults to filling out the daily reflection rather than pain when opening the app. Definitely recommend for chronic pain sufferers!

Really useful for tracking pain, and I like all the options they give you for stuff. Plus you can make your own! I just started tracking my pain and this app has helped give a visual of how much I neglect to address my physical health. Glad I stumbled upon this :)

I started using this app because I know I will need a lengthy history to be diagnosed with fibromyalgia. I like how easy this app is to use and record my daily symptoms and over all how Im feeling. This app is super helpful.
Love this. Most apps that track your activities etc are very limited without subscribing but this one has a lot of free features and is a great way of keeping track of patterns

title: Arthritis & Rheumatology
description:
“Arthritis & Rheumatology” brings you a stimulating, high-impact mixture of review articles, editorials, and other educational material intended for both researchers and clinicians. Enjoy an entirely new browsing and reading experience, and keep up to date with the most important developments in rheumatology research even faster:

- Stay current with the latest articles through Early View
- Be notified when a new issue is available.
- Download articles and issues for offline perusal.
- Save your favorite articles for quick and easy access.
- Share articles with colleagues or students.

title: TRACK + REACT
description:
Update: Our latest release has fixed the bug related to some users receiving an invalid email address warning when signing up. 

Discover the impact of your daily activities on your arthritis pain with TRACK + REACT. Track your nutrition, fitness, sleep, medication and mood and compare it to your arthritis pain in the Arthritis Impact graph.
 
TRACK + REACT Features:
- Understand which activities are impacting your arthritis pain
- Input your information in a secure environment
- Identify trends over time in the Arthritis Impact graph
- Use the web application (www.arthritis.org/trackandreact) to print your Arthritis Impact graph to share with your health care provider.
- Find advice and tips from the experts you trust at the Arthritis Foundation

Feedback from Users:
“The graph is extremely helpful.  It quantifies what I do and how this impacts my life.  Otherwise I just have a vague idea that I'm either feeling OK or not.  This shows concretely how I can impact how I feel.”
 
“This is an AWESOME tool and exactly what I need to be working with to help myself manage my life and especially health and well-being.”

title: Rheumatology Connect
description:
Rheumatology Connect is a great source of information for people in the Torbay area with rheumatic conditions. These include:
Rheumatoid arthritis
Psoriatic arthritis
Spondyloarthritis or Ankylosing Spondylitis
Osteoarthritis
Gout and Pseudogout 
Connective tissue diseases including SLE, Sjogren’s, scleroderma, myositis and vasculitis
With the help of high-quality and informative videos, this app describes each condition and explains which treatments are available.

You’ll also find contact information for people at the Torbay Rheumatology Department who you can contact by email or telephone for advice, as well as a range of support documents and guides that can help you manage your condition.

Developed by Dr Kirsten Mackay, the Rheumatology Department, existing patients and Health & Care Videos, this app will support you throughout your time with the Torbay Hospital. It brings all the information you need into one place and ensures help is never too far away.

title: Best Foods for Arthritis
description:
Foods for Arthritis is a simple app that compiles all top best 16 foods for arthritis in one single app! All information and benefits of each food are clearly explained.

Are you tired of the chronic ache of arthritis pain? Why not try changes in your diet to get some relief?

Although there is no diet cure for arthritis, certain foods have been shown to fight inflammation, strengthen bones and boost the immune system. Adding these foods to your balanced diet may help ease the symptoms of your arthritis and boost your health.

Features:
-OFFLINE - No internet connection required
-Lightweight - About 3MB only
-Always FREE!

title: Workout for Arthritis
description:
This app outlines six very important steps take to relieve the pain of osteoarthritis, while keeping your joints in good working condition. 
With arthritis, pain relief is probably the first thing on your mind. In most cases, it’s the pain that prompts a patient to seek help. Your physician will advise you on the best way to relieve this pain. After you’ve received this advice, this app can help remind you of the things he’s advised you to do. For example, it tells how to apply heat to aching joints, and explains the Importance of taking your medicine to relieve pain or to prevent the pain from getting worse.
This app also illustrates a series of exercises specifically intended for arthritic joints: to help keep them flexible and to help control the pain. This app is reference for doctors and patients.

title: PainScale - Free Chronic Pain Tracker Diary
description:
The Popular pain tracking app for iOS and Android !.  Awarded one of the Best Fibromyalgia apps of 2019 – by Healthline. Join over 100,000 chronic pain patients who manage and scale their pain and symptoms with Painscale; the highly-ranked pain tracker health app on the web! 

The PainScale app offers a FREE suite of pain management tools to help chronic pain patients to scale their pain.
Manage a Pain Tracker Diary!

Created with input from doctors and chronic pain patients, the Pain Diary acts as a pain tracker and organizes all the information the patient needs in one accessible location. With over 800 organized articles, health tips, exercises, information on pain meditation programs and treatment options, pain management becomes easier.   	

PainScale provides personalized pain management education for users. Trusted content. is available to help people understand their symptoms and better manage their condition. By providing insights to a community of other patients who share their treatment information, PainScale helps patients discover information about treatment options that may work for their condition.
PainScale is an easy and simple to use, pain and health tracker app.
 
Features

 • Pain Diary – log and track your pain to track triggers, pain intensity, symptoms, treatments, medications, activity, mood, and sleep digital scale.
 • Pain Reports – get and send summary and detailed reports for better patient-physician communication, you can take all the information you need from the Pain Diary.
 • Insights - personal tips to help you discover information about treatment options to better manage your condition
• Trusted Content – get FREE access to a searchable library of articles, videos, and meditations to help find pain relief,
 • Daily Health Tips – get daily meditation, stretches, and exercise routines, everything you need to help you cope with your chronic pain
 • Integration with Google Fit – simplified and seamless connectivity with Google Fit for tracking health and fitness activity
 • Reminders – get reminders to help stay engaged with restoring your health
 • Care Team Communication - tap-to-call and tap-to message functionality options that connects you directly with your Physician and Support Network
 • Customize your experience for pain management with a personal profile
Get the info you need in the following topics:

 • Chronic pain
 • Pain relief
 • Lower back pain
 • Back pain
 • Neck pain
 • A migraine
 • Fibromyalgia
 • Failed back surgery
 • CRPS
 • Arthritis
 • Pain management
 • Coping
 • Neuropathy
 • Nerve pain

Get Help: contact us at help@painscale.com
Visit Us: Access your account on the web.

Log in at https://www.painscale.com
Like Us: Join the PainScale community by liking us on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/MyPainScale/
 

What are the things that make your pain increase, what spikes or triggers it, and what helps you the most?
PainScale helps you get actionable insights to better your pain relief and health in general. 

Pain scale and pain diary have been used by physicians for almost five decades – it is one of the most valuable tools in pain management. Painscale.com takes advantage of the modern digital technologies to provide an easy to use pain tracking solution using the same proven pain management methods. PainScale.com web site and the app is designed for educational purposes only. If you have any concerns about your own health or the health of someone else, you should always consult with a physician or other healthcare professional

comments: Outstanding App to help you track pain types, areas and symptoms. Able to show different pain types in different areas of the body. I love that you can add notes as well in journal entries! The reports are fantastic and easy to email with you deciding the custom time span. The insights that can show correlation between activity, weather, and other triggers really helps. Love that I can attach to Samsung Health and thus my sleep, EKGs and pulse rate, BP, etc to see correlations! Great App!!!

I've been using this app for months now and I still love it. It's easy to use, it syncs with my Samsung Health, and the helpful articles and tips are normally quick reads and informative, and it has easy adjustments in the settings. I highly recommend this app.

So far it's a good useful app. One suggestion. Love to have ability to add multiple entries during the day without altering my earlier input.This will help me better track triggers and effectiveness of the different things I do to help alleviate my pain. Also, there needs to be room for more than one entry for doc location,insurance& pain on opposite side of the body.If I have pain in back of legs and knees, the figure turns around but deleted the previous tagged body pain location.

I've only been using this app for a short time but so far it is the best that I have tried. I have chronic pain with various etiologies and the app has a detailed pain map that allows me to more precisely record my pain. The automatic time stamp is a great feature as is the ability to link it to my Fitbit for superior insights that corralate sleep and activity to pain levels. Im holding off on that 5th star because I am still learning the app and all of its functionality.

The PainScale app has been great! I am able to track my whole day. Pain, food and anything else I need. I have added my glucose readings in the notes. I am also able to put on there my activities making me able to see any issues and also my progress. Thank you!

title: Arthritis Treatment
description:
Arthritis is a joint disorder featuring inflammation. A joint is an area of the body where two different bones meet. A joint functions to move the body parts connected by its bones. Arthritis literally means inflammation of one or more joints.
Arthritis is inflammation in and around the body’s joints. Some types of arthritis include but are not limited to osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, psoriatic arthritis and gout. 
However, arthritis affects people in all age groups, including almost 300,000 children. 
The goals of treatment are to increase joint mobility and strength and help patients learn to manage pain.
Arthritis is frequently accompanied by joint pain. Joint pain is referred to as arthralgia. When four or more joints are involved, the arthritis is referred to as polyarthritis. 
When two or three joints are involved, it is referred to as oligoarthritis. When only a single joint is involved, it is referred to as monoarthritis.
Osteoarthritis is the most common type of arthritis. When the cartilage  the slick, cushioning surface on the ends of bones  wears away, bone rubs against bone, causing pain, swelling and stiffness. 
Over time, joints can lose strength and pain may become chronic. Risk factors include excess weight, family history, age and previous injury.
DWONLOAD this App for free to know more about Arthritis symptoms, Arthritis causes and Arthritis treatement and rheumatologist Diagnosis .

title: myVectra
description:
Track it. Show it. Feel better. myVectra™! 
Built for people living with rheumatoid arthritis (RA), myVectra is a revolutionary app which lets you track your RA, create visual snapshots of your data, and communicate about your RA like never before. Now you can track what is important to YOU, whenever, wherever. “How are you doing?” It’s not always an easy question to answer, particularly when you’re living with and managing an ever-changing disease like RA.  We all know that with RA, symptoms can change from month-to-month…even day-to-day. With myVectra, you can generate a visual summary report of your tracked data so you and your doctor can see how you’re doing…and how things have changed since your last doctor visit!  Your doctor needs to know how you’re doing to treat your RA and help you feel better. More effective than a journal. Prettier than a spreadsheet. Say it with myVectra!

title: Rheumatools
description:
Cette application vous accompagne dans les différentes étapes de la prise en charge de votre patient. Divisée en six rubriques très complète, elle propose des outils indispensables : scores interactifs, fiches pratiques, tableaux récapitulatifs, recommandations mises à jour, photos et critères diagnostic par pathologie. 

Cette application médicale est à destination des professionnels de santé prenant en charge les maladies ostéo-articulaires ainsi que les maladies systémiques. 

L’objectif de cette application est d’aider le professionnel de santé dans sa pratique quotidienne.

Plusieurs groupes d’outils sont à disposition :
- Critères diagnostiques et de classifications des principaux rhumatismes inflammatoires, maladies systémiques, des pathologies microcristallines mais aussi des pathologies mécaniques.
- Bilans Préthérapeutiques des antirhumatismaux biologiques et synthétiques ainsi que les biphosphonates.
- Posologies des principales thérapeutiques (DMARDs, AINS, corticoïdes, antiostéoporotiques etc…) en rhumatologie en fonction des différentes pathologies.
- Ordonnances de surveillance de traitements antirhumatismaux biologiques et synthétiques.
- Les différents Scores d’activité des rhumatismes inflammatoires chroniques et des maladies systémiques ainsi que le score de FRAX et autres calculs de la calcémie corrigée, IMC ou surface corporelle.
- Infiltrations : modalités de réalisation de gestes infiltratifs avec repères, technique et gestions des anticoagulants/antiagrégants.
 Aucune donnée relative à l’identité du patient n’est stockée dans l’application ni sur un serveur à distance.

Cette application médicale a été coordonnée sur le plan scientifique par les :

· Docteur Baptiste Coustet, service de rhumatologie, CHU Bichat-Claude Bernard, Paris
· Professeur Philippe Dieudé, service de rhumatologie, CHU Bichat-Claude Bernard, Paris
· Docteur Sébastien Ottaviani, service de rhumatologie, CHU Bichat-Claude Bernard, Paris.

title: SMART Arthritis
description:
Claim independence and improve your mobility with SMA®T Arthritis, a revolutionary app that accurately pinpoints the area of inflammation from knee arthritis to develop a customized pain management and treatment plan providing with a precise tool to identify the zone for intensive medicine application.

SMA®T Arthritis is a leading edge solution that acts as in-home monitoring for knee arthritis. With easy operation and heat zone imaging, arthritis sufferers can now manage their inflammation and arthritis pain right from the comfort of their own homes. Not only is it used to identify the exact location of inflammation to serve as a roadmap to applying anti-inflammatory medicines, the app also helps with the management of rheumatoid arthritis pain (and other arthritis pain) by structuring the right treatment plan based on inflammation stemming from an individual’s unique diet and physical activity with its built in diary system. In addition to real-time monitoring, SMA®T Arthritis is an efficient way to correct current physical activities and determine proper physical exercises and foods that don’t cause inflammation in the knee, offering improved insight into developing a customized form of treatment, like the best arthritis medicine to use or which home remedies for arthritis are having the most impact.

SMA®T Arthritis eliminates the guesswork and pinpoints the exact source of knee pain.

Inflammation in the knee is the cause of pain, but the location of the pain is oftentimes different that where the actual inflammation is located. SMA®T Arthritis offers a safe, efficient and easy way to pinpoint the exact area where inflammation occurs in order to provide individuals with the accurate place to apply anti-inflammatory medicines. A red zone will appear on the imaging, indicating where to apply your gel or cream to target the source of inflammation and maximize your treatment.

An arthritis diet plan including rheumatoid arthritis diet plan is an important element in reducing inflammation and living a well-rounded life. Different foods can have an impact on an inflammation, which is why tracking your arthritis inflammation with SMA®T Arthritis can offer greater insight into your health and lifestyle. If you are suffering from arthritis, the foods to avoid list may differ based on your level of arthritis and overall diet.

SMA®T Arthritis offers a unique approach to arthritis pain management through thermal images that identify the area of inflammation. The app serves as a real-time, interactive way of managing inflammation from knee arthritis and can create a personal health care diary that tracks improvement over time, adding valuable insight into an individual’s overall treatment therapy. Every individual’s pain management plan is unique and SMA®T Arthritis allows for the selection of the most effective treatment plan, saving money and avoiding unnecessary side effects stemming from inaccurate treatment options.

Similar to glucometers apps or blood pressure apps which have improved the lives of individuals around the world, SMA®T Arthritis works to create the same level of independence and authority over one's’ health care. SMA®T Arthritis allows individuals to take an active role in the management of their arthritis knee pain. The app helps support an independent, mobile life, giving freedom to individuals who would otherwise be debilitated and isolated by their condition. It also helps reduce overall pain by identifying dietary changes and remedies as a means of reducing inflammation.

Compatibility and Use

Apple Health app (requires iOS 9) integration, if activated: reads daily step count.
The SMA®T Arthritis sensor attaches to smartphone through an audio jack, for ease of use.

Legal

SMA®T Arthritis is not intended for diagnostics purposes and should only be used after receiving a diagnosis "knee arthritis" by a doctor. SMA®T Arthritis technology and the SMA®T Arthritis trademark are patented in EU, Japan, China etc.

title: Arthritis Guide
description:
Arthritis pain: Arthritis is a group of painful and degenerative conditions marked by inflammation in the joints that causes stiffness and pain. Osteoarthritis, the most common type of arthritis, gets worse with age and is caused by wear and tear over the years. Rheumatoid arthritis is caused by the immune system attacking the joints as if they were foreign tissues. Because of this, rheumatoid arthritis is classified as an autoimmune disease.

Doctors traditionally treat arthritis with anti-inflammatory medications and painkillers. However, some medications cause side effects, and a natural approach to pain relief is becoming more popular. Remember to consult your doctor before trying these natural remedies.

1. Lose weight
Your weight can make a big impact on the amount of pain you experience from arthritis. Extra weight puts more pressure on your joints — especially your knees, hips, and feet.

Reducing the stress on your joints by losing weight will improve your mobility, decrease pain, and prevent future damage to your joints.

2. Get more exercise
There are more benefits to exercise than just weight loss. Regular movement helps to maintain flexibility in your joints. Weight-bearing exercises such as running and walking can be damaging. Instead, try low-impact exercises such as water aerobics or swimming to flex your joints without adding further stress.

3. Use hot and cold therapy
Simple hot and cold treatments can make a world of difference when it comes to arthritis pain. Long, warm showers or baths — especially in the morning — help ease stiffness in your joints. Use an electric blanket or moist heating pad at night to keep your joints loose.

Cold treatments are best for relieving joint pain, swelling, and inflammation. Wrap a gel ice pack or a bag of frozen vegetables in a towel and apply it to painful joints for quick relief.

4. Try acupuncture
Acupuncture is an ancient Chinese medical treatment that involves inserting thin needles into specific points on your body. This is supposed to reroute energies and restore balance in your body. Acupuncture is the most researched complementary therapy and is recommended by the World Health Organization for treatment of over 100 different conditions.

It is thought that acupuncture has the ability to reduce arthritis pain. If you want to explore this treatment method, be sure to find a licensed and certified acupuncturist in your state.

5. Use meditation to cope with pain
Meditation and relaxation techniques may be able to help you reduce pain from arthritis by reducing stress and enabling you to cope with it better. According to the National Institutes of Health (NIH), studies have found that the practice of mindfulness meditation is helpful for some people with painful joints. Researchers also found that those with depression and arthritis benefitted the most from meditation. When stress is reduced, inflammation and thus swelling and pain drop.

Arthritis Guide Main Features: 

✅ arthritis ✅
✅ rheumatoid arthritis ✅
✅ arthritis in hands ✅
✅ arthritis pain relief ✅

title: Knee Pain Relieving Exercises
description:
As an orthopaedic surgeon i come across many people who suffer from KNEE PAIN. In majority of the cases , the simple exercises can do wonders. Though it takes a time (approx. 2 months) before before the effect of exercises are appreciated. 

OSTEOARTHRITIS,  RHEUMATOID ARTHRITIS, MENISCAL INJURY, AFTER KNEE REPLACEMENT, patients shall be benefited with these exercises. 

why we had developed this application :
1) Lot of exercises given on internet but difficult to TRUST as they are being propagated by techies without knowledge of knee biomechanics
2) many a times visit to a physio centre is not possible due to daily busy schedule
3) we tend to forget things when not carried out regularly, so a handout is easy
4) PRECAUTIONS are all we ask from our doctors, but many a times we forget to tell one or the other precaution
5) there were languages issues in my part of the world so i had translated it in HINDI AND PUNJABI. 

THE MOBILE APP IS FREE OF COST, THERE ARE NO PERMISSIONS, NO ADS, LOW ON SPACE(6 MB),ETC.

The mobile application has been specifically designed for people suffering from knee pain or arthritis of knee joint. it shall help in strengthening the muscles and decrease the knee pain markedly thus avoiding the need for knee replacement in selected cases.

title: Treatment of arthritis
description:
What is arthritis?
Arthritis is an inflammation of the joints. It can affect one joint or multiple joints. There are more than 100 different types of arthritis, with different causes and treatment methods. Two of the most common types are osteoarthritis (OA) and rheumatoid arthritis (RA).

The symptoms of arthritis usually develop over time, but they may also appear suddenly. Arthritis is most commonly seen in adults over the age of 65, but it can also develop in children, teens, and younger adults. Arthritis is more common in women than men and in people who are overweight.

title: ArthritisPower
description: The ArthritisPower registry was developed to empower people with arthritis, bone, autoimmune, and inflammatory skin diseases to fight back by participating in real-world, patient-centric research. With this app, you will be able to track YOUR symptoms, health and wellness using surveys, completing validated patient reporting outcomes questionnaires and using data captured by your phone (biosensor data) to monitor well-being. ArthritisPower enables participants to also track medications, medical history and to share health information with care providers, family members, etc. at their discretion. ArthritisPower has the ability to run on a smartphone App and on the web for PCs, giving participants the ability to stay connected whenever they want. Come join the fight and help others as you help yourself, track your health and use your data to help combat joint, bone and skin diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis, psoriasis, psoriatic arthritis, ankylosing spondylitis, lupus, gout and other conditions.

title: Osteoarthritis Joint Pain Treatment Home Remedies
description:
In this app we have tried compiling information on causes symptoms treatment prevention home remedies foods to eat and avoid for osteoarthritis. Osteoarthritis, the most common form of arthritis caused by cartilage degeneration, is affecting many people worldwide especially the older age.

The most common symptom of osteoarthritis is pain in the affected joint or joints but other osteoarthritis symptoms and signs include
* swollen joints
* joint stiffness
* joint creaking
* loss of range of motion
Osteoarthritis commonly affects hands, feet, spine, and the large weight-bearing joints, such as the hips and knees but any joint in the body can be affected.
Although it is not a diseases but just a natural ageing of the joints and can be hereditary too. Certain conditions like obesity, diabetes, gout, hormone disorders are also associated with secondary osteoarthritis. There is no blood test performed for the diagnosis of osteoarthritis.

This app provides you complete information on the osteoarthritis !!

title: Arthritis Guide
description:
Rhеumаtоіd аrthrіtіѕ (RA) іѕ a tуре оf inflammatory arthritis. RA disease іѕ сhаrасtеrіzеd bу chronic joint іnflаmmаtіоn (іn the fіngеrѕ, hаndѕ, knees, feet, for example). RA mау аlѕо be called rhеumаtоіd dіѕеаѕе because аt tіmеѕ rhеumаtоіd arthritis causes systemic іllnеѕѕ thаt іmрасtѕ mаnу оrgаnѕ оf the bоdу. 
 
Whіlе early ѕуmрtоmѕ оf RA саn bе mіmісkеd by other dіѕеаѕеѕ, thе ѕуmрtоmѕ and signs аrе vеrу сhаrасtеrіѕtіс оf rhеumаtоіd dіѕеаѕе. Thе 16 еаrlу RA ѕуmрtоmѕ аnd signs discussed іn this аrtісlе іnсludе thе following: 
 
Fаtіguе 
Joint раіn 
Jоіnt tenderness 
Jоіnt ѕwеllіng 
Jоіnt redness 
Jоіnt wаrmth 
Jоіnt ѕtіffnеѕѕ 
Lоѕѕ оf joint rаngе of motion 
Mаnу jоіntѕ аffесtеd (роlуаrthrіtіѕ) 
Lіmріng 
Joint dеfоrmіtу 
Bоth ѕіdеѕ оf thе bоdу аffесtеd (ѕуmmеtrіс) 
Lоѕѕ оf joint function 
Anеmіа 
Fеvеr 
Depression

title: Remedies for Joints Pain
description:
I am assuming that most of the readers of this article are aware of the basics of arthritis and I am not going into finer details of the disease per se here. This article is dedicated to discussing about the natural remedies for joint pain and hence I will stick to the point.

Conventionally arthritis has been managed with analgesics called as Non Steroidal Anti Inflammatories (NSAIDs). NSAIDs cause dangerous side effects like gastric ulceration and they also increase the risk of heart disease and strokes. Thus both patients and their doctors are not averse to looking at Mother Nature to help ease the joint pain in arthritis. While natural and herbal remedies are generally free from side effects and are reasonably effective they might interfere with other prescription medications. It is therefore prudent on the part of the patient to check with their doctors first before starting these medications.

There are a whole range of natural remedies for joint pain and it would be practically impossible to go through all of them but I will list the ones that are most effective with reasonable scientific backing to their use.

Glucosamine and Chondroitin: Perhaps no other natural remedy have been as extensively studied as these two. Both Glucosamine and Chondroitin are found naturally occurring in the joints and with wear and tear of the joints these reduce dramatically in an arthritic joint. It is thus appropriate that there should be some relief from joint pains when one substitutes these ingredients in the joint.

Omega 3 fatty acids: Omega 3 fatty acids have a wide range of beneficial effects in the human body. Derived from fish oils they reduce inflammation and pain of many chronic conditions.

Bromelain: Derived from the Papaya fruit, Bromelain has shown good anti-inflammatory effect and is an analgesic too.

MethylSulfonylMethane: MSM occurs naturally in plants and animals and preliminary studies have shown promise as a good analgesic in arthritis.
Devil's claw and Cat's claw: Both these herbs have potent anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties and have been used for centuries for their effectiveness not only in arthritis but also in other ailments.

Boswellia (Indian Frankincense): Regular use of Boswellia improves blood flow to the joints thus resulting in a well-nourished and viable joint tissue. Boswellia has been used in traditional Ayurveda since times immemorial.

title: OPERAS Arthritis
description:
OPERAS will help you monitor how active your arthritis is, your symptoms and mood, along with your physical activity, to get the whole picture of your health.

OPERAS also helps in other ways, too, by allowing you to keep track of your medications, record notes about your health, and create action plans to assist you in reaching your health goals. It also helps you to set and track your physical activity goals by capturing and displaying information collected by Fitbit, a wearable activity device. This information can help you better understand how your physical activity relates to how you feel overall.

If you have been diagnosed with Rheumatoid Arthritis, you may be eligible to participate in this study and use the OPERAS tool. Please contact Johnathan Tam at 604-207-4027 or at operas@arthritisresearch.ca for more details.

It also helps you to set and track your physical activity goals by capturing and displaying information collected by Fitbit, a wearable activity device. This information can help you better understand how your physical activity relates to how you feel overall.

If you have been diagnosed with Rheumatoid Arthritis, you may be eligible to participate in this study and use the OPERAS tool. Please contact Johnathan Tam at 604-207-4027 or at operas@arthritisresearch.ca for more details.
summary: OPERAS helps people with rheumatoid arthritis self manage their disease.

title: Your Exercise Solution
description: Exercise can help ease arthritis pain – but which one is best? The answer is as unique as you are. Your Exercise Solution tool provides a personalized exercise plan. You will be able to identify where you have pain, select your current fitness level, choose an activity that is right for you and learn modifications that let you exercise safely.

title: HOW TO CURE JOINT PAIN
description:
Joints form the connections between bones. They provide support and help you move. Any damage to the joints from disease or injury can interfere with your movement and cause a lot of pain.

Many different conditions can lead to painful joints, including osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, bursitis, gout, strains, sprains, and other injuries. Joint pain is extremely common. In one national survey, about one-third of adults reported having joint pain within the past 30 days. Knee pain was the most common complaint, followed by shoulder and hip pain, but joint pain can affect any part of your body, from your ankles and feet to your shoulders and hands. As you get older, painful joints become increasingly more common.

Joint pain can range from mildly irritating to debilitating. It may go away after a few weeks (acute), or last for several weeks or months (chronic). Even short-term pain and swelling in the joints can affect your quality of life. Whatever the cause of joint pain, you can usually manage it with medication, physical therapy, or alternative treatments.

Your doctor will first try to diagnose and treat the condition that is causing your joint pain. The goal is to reduce pain and inflammation, and preserve joint function. 

By Downloading and using this FREE How to Cure Joint Pain App you will learn;

Common Causes of Joint Pain
Is It Arthritis?
Taking Advantage of Your Natural Endorphins
Tips for Living with Chronic  Pain

AND
Much much more..........


Disclaimer:
The info contained in the app is not a substitute for professional medical or health advice, examination, diagnosis, or treatment. This app disclaims any liability for any decisions you make based on the information provided.
